template: Generate one single-sentence plain-English prompt describing an end-to-end content campaign task in the {industry} space that involves research, multi-format content creation, consistency across channels, and measurable goals; output only the prompt text under 45 words.
filled_prompt: Generate one single-sentence plain-English prompt describing an end-to-end content campaign task in the education space that involves research, multi-format content creation, consistency across channels, and measurable goals; output only the prompt text under 45 words.

message.content: Research and create a coordinated campaign of blog posts, videos, and emails to increase course enrollment through consistent messaging and tracked engagement.
message.reasoning_content:
Okay, the user wants me to generate a single-sentence prompt for an education content campaign. Let me break down their requirements. They mentioned it needs to cover research, multi-format creation, channel consistency, and measurable goals. Also, under 45 words and in plain English.

First, I need to include all four elements without going over the word limit. Maybe start with the research part. "Research and create a campaign" could work. Then add the multi-format aspect—specify types like blog posts and videos. 

Next, consistency across channels is important. Words like "coordinated" or "unified" might fit. Finally, measurable goals need a clear outcome, like "increase enrollment." Let me try combining: Research and create blog posts, videos, and emails that work together to boost course sign-ups.

Wait, is that under 45 words? Let me count. Yes, it fits. Make sure it flows naturally as one sentence. Maybe adjust "work together" to "form a coordinated campaign" for better clarity. That should cover all the user’s points.
